title: About Me

title: Projects
section: 1. PFAS, PHTHTE, and Heavy Metals Analysis - University of North Carolina, Charlotte
text:
1. PFAS, PHTHTE, and Heavy Metals Analysis - University of North Carolina, Charlotte

Description: Conducted exploratory data analysis on PFAS, PHTHTE, and heavy metals data from 1999â€“2018. Identified trends, correlations, and patterns over time with final goal of creating dashboard.
Tools Used: Python, Pandas, Matplotlib, seasborn, HTML
Highlights:

Cleaned and preprocessed data from multiple years.

Visualized distributions and created heatmaps of correlations.

Stratified data by demographics (e.g., gender and age).

Utlized HTML to create foundational structure of dashboard.

title: Projects
section: 2. Florence-2 Vision-Language Model for Anomaly Detection
text:
2. Florence-2 Vision-Language Model for Anomaly Detection

Description: Worked on training the Florence-2 vision-language model for detecting anomalies in public spaces.
Tools Used: PyTorch, Hugging Face, TensorRT
Highlights:

Fine-tuned the pre-trained model for specific tasks.
Implemented visual grounding, object detection, and segmentation.
Researched techniques to distinguish normal vs.Â anomalous events.

title: Projects
text:
3. Sentiment Analysis for Book Reviews

Description: Built and evaluated machine learning models to classify sentiment in book reviews. Explored various algorithms to improve prediction accuracy.
Tools Used: Python, Scikit-Learn, Random Forest, Logistic Regression
Highlights:

Achieved highest accuracy with logistic regression.

Performed feature engineering to improve model performance.


Explore Results

title: Projects
section: 2. Florence-2 Vision-Language Model for Weapon Detection
text:
2. Florence-2 Vision-Language Model for Weapon Detection

Description: Worked on training the Florence-2 vision-language model for detecting weapons in public spaces.
Tools Used: PyTorch, Hugging Face, Florence-2
Highlights:

Fine-tuned the pre-trained model for specific tasks.

Implemented visual grounding, object detection, and segmentation.

Researched LoRA technique.

title: Projects
text:
4. Battleship in R

Description: Developed an interactive implementation of the Battleship game using R. This project combines game logic with statistical insights.
Tools Used: R, ggplot2
Highlights:

Designed an interactive game board with randomized ship placement.

Implemented user input validation and game logic.

Visualized gameplay progress using dynamic plots.

Implemented a Smart Player encoded with density probability function for best performance.
